title: Lanark Park Loch Walking Route

images.title: M22RDY / Lanark Loch - Looking Towards Lanark Golf Course
images.caption: Lanark Loch - Looking Towards Lanark Golf Course.

images.title: M22RDY / Lanark Loch - Looking On Larark Loch From The Main Entrance
images.caption: Main Entrance view.

images.title: M22RDY / Lanark Loch - Bridge Over Sandy Burn
images.caption: Bridge Over Sandy Burn. The Sandy Burn leads down into Lanark Loch, this bridge is there the burn meets the loch.

images.title: M22RDY / Lanark Loch - Water Feature
images.caption: Water Feature. This is a man made water feature next to the loch.

images.title: M22RDY / Lanark Loch - Corner Hidden Behind The Trees
images.caption: Corner Hidden Behind The Trees. This area of the loch isn't visible from the main entrance, it can be found on the right hand side of the loch going round the first corner.

images.title: M22RDY / Lanark Loch - Old Cemented Well
images.caption: This cemented shut well is located beside the Golf Course at the back of the loch.

description: Enjoy a lovely walk on the lochside path in this country park in Lanark. The loch is surrounded by some truly beautiful countryside and in the summer you can hire bumper boats. There's also a putting green, a picnic area and play park so it's a nice day out for families. The park is about 1 mile from Lanark train station and has on site parking. If you would like to continue your walk you could head to the nearby Falls of Clyde Nature Reserve where you can enjoy woodlands, waterfalls and a walk along the River Clyde. You can also pick up the Clyde Walkway here.
